intro: Pyrostria antsirananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar flame tree, is a striking evergreen tree native to the eastern rainforests of Madagascar. It is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and its showy, fiery red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other economically important species like the cashew and mango. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable subject in botanical studies and conservation efforts. The tree plays a vital role in its ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various local wildlife species.
